page.title: 17Religious Practice/Blaby
page.content: There are two Primary Schools in Blaby. One has no religious affili- ation. One, Stokes School, founded between 1711 and 1724_ by Edward Stokes,Rector of Blaby, is a Church of England School admitting children of all denominations.They attend services in Church for Christmas and Founders Day in June. Rev Canon Crowther-Green is Chairman of Governors. Rev David Gamston,the Baptist Minister takes occasional Assemblies and is a friend to the school in many ways. {Places of {worship in survey area-}Anglican, Baptist, Methodist & Congregational Churches. All have Sunday schools, approx.quarter of chn. attend.{Church {attendance.}229 homes surveyed, only 133 replied.{Attendance}:a) Regularly: adults 13%, children 27% b) Occasionally : adults 49%, child.43%. c) Never : adults 38%, child.30%.{
